casebody.data:
QUALITY BUILT HOMES INCORPORATED, et al.
v.
TOWN OF CARTHAGE 315PA15-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 3, 2017 James E. Scarbrough, Attorney at Law, James R. DeMay, Attorney at Law, Concord, John F. Scarborough, Attorney at Law, for Quality Built Homes Incorporated, et al. Susan K. Burkhart, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Town of Carthage Stephen D. Feldman, Attorney at Law, Paul M. Cox, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Steven A. Scoggan, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, F. Paul Calamita, III, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Water Quality Association and Seven Municipalities

The following order has been entered on the conditional motion filed on the 14th of February 2017 by NC Water Quality Association and Seven Municipalities for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 3rd of May 2017."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
